question: You are a coding expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you provide is executable and functional. Help me create a webpage for reading novels, with the requirement that all resources are free.

checklist.title: Is the core novel reading functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements essential reading features: chapter navigation, bookmarking, text display with proper formatting, and reading progress tracking. Score 0 if core reading functionality is missing, 5 if basic text display is implemented, and 10 if all essential reading features are included with smooth transitions between chapters.

checklist.title: Is the content management system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes functionality to manage novel content: importing/adding new novels, organizing content by categories/genres, search functionality, and history tracking. Deduct 5 points if search functionality is missing, 3 points if category organization is absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is user experience for extended reading properly addressed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the implementation includes eye-care features (dark mode, font size adjustment, line spacing, margins), reading time tracking, and mobile responsiveness. Deduct 3 points if font customization is missing, 3 points if dark mode is not implemented, and 4 points if the design isn't responsive. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is content sourcing handled legally and efficiently?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code uses legal sources for content (public domain works, user-uploaded content with proper rights management, or APIs with proper attribution). Check if content is cached locally to reduce bandwidth usage. Deduct 5 points if no content source verification exists, 5 points if copyright notices are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network interruptions, missing book content, broken images, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Text-to-speech functionality 2. Reading statistics and analytics 3. Social sharing with highlights 4. Vocabulary builder for difficult words). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple theme switchers) 2. Function modules unrelated to novel reading (e.g., a built-in game) 3. Fancy effects that affect loading speed and reading experience (e.g., excessive animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating UI/data/state management), code reusability, and performance optimization techniques. Deduct 5 points if global state is poorly managed; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no performance optimization for large texts is implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching suitable for extended reading (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (consistent margins, paragraphs properly separated) 3) Professional typography (readable font choices, proper line height 1.5-1.8, optimal line length 60-80 characters). Deduct 3 points for poor spacing, 5 points for poor readability, and 5 points for cluttered layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Page turning feels natural with appropriate animations 2) UI controls appear/disappear smoothly when needed 3) Loading indicators for content fetching. Deduct 5 points for jarring page transitions, 3 points for laggy scrolling, and 5 points for hard-to-access reading controls. The full score is 10 points.
